name: Butter Chicken
ingredients: 500 gm boneless chicken, cut into cubes
method: 1. Heat butter in a pan and saute onion till translucent. 2. Add ginger and garlic paste and cook for a minute. 3. Add chicken and cook until browned. 4. Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Mix well. 5. Add tomato puree and cook for 5 minutes. 6. Add cream and cook for another 2 minutes. 7. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Aloo Gobi
method: 1. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. 2. When they splutter, add onion and cook till golden brown. 3. Add ginger and garlic paste and cook for a minute. 4. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well. 5. Add potatoes and cauliflower. Mix well. 6. Add tomato and cook for 10-15 minutes. 7. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Chole Bhature
method:
1. Pressure cook chickpeas till soft. 2. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. 3. When they splutter, add onion and cook till golden brown. 4. Add ginger and garlic paste and cook for a minute. 5. Add chopped tomatoes, green chillies, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Mix well. 6. Add cooked chickpeas and 1 cup water. Mix well. 7. Cook for 10-15 minutes. 8. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with bhature.

For Bhature:
1. Mix all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. 2. Add curd and mix well. 3. Add water as needed to make a soft dough. 4. Cover and rest for 2 hours. 5. Divide the dough into small balls. 6. Roll out each ball into a circle. 7. Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the bhature till golden brown. 8. Serve hot with chole.

name: Chole Kulcha
method:
1. Pressure cook chickpeas till soft. 2. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. 3. When they splutter, add onion and cook till golden brown. 4. Add ginger and garlic paste and cook for a minute. 5. Add chopped tomatoes, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Mix well. 6. Add cooked chickpeas and 1 cup water. Mix well. 7. Cook for 10-15 minutes. 8. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with kulcha.
For Kulcha:
1. Mix all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. 2. Add curd and mix well. 3. Add water as needed to make a soft dough. 4. Cover and rest for 2 hours. 5. Divide the dough into small balls. 6. Roll out each ball into a circle. 7. Heat oil in a pan and cook the kulcha on both sides till golden brown. 8. Serve hot with chole.

name: Matar Paneer
method: 1. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. 2. When they splutter, add onion and cook till golden brown. 3. Add ginger and garlic paste and cook for a minute. 4. Add chopped tomatoes, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Mix well. 5. Add green peas and cook for 5 minutes. 6. Add paneer and cook for another 5 minutes. 7. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Tandoori Chicken
method: 1. Clean and wash the chicken. 2. Make deep cuts on the chicken pieces. 3. In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt. 4. Add the chicken pieces and mix well. 5. Marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight in the refrigerator. 6. Preheat the oven to 200°C. 7. Thread the chicken pieces onto skewers. 8. Place the skewers on a baking tray and bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes, turning occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and lightly charred. 9. Garnish with lemon wedges and serve hot.

name: Keema Matar
method: 1. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat. 2. Add the onions, garlic, and green chilies and fry for 5-7 minutes until the onions are golden brown. 3. Add the lamb pieces and fry for 5-7 minutes until the lamb is sealed and lightly browned. 4. Add the turmeric, cumin, coriander, and paprika and stir well. 5. Add salt to taste and cook for a further 10-15 minutes or until the lamb is cooked through. 6. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

name: Poha Jalebi
method: 1. Rinse the poha in water and drain. 2. Heat oil in a pan and add chopped onions. Saute until golden brown. 3. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. 4. Add chopped green chillies, peanuts, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, and salt. Mix well. 5. Add the rinsed poha and mix well. 6. Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally. 7. Serve hot with jalebi. 8. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

name: Aam Panna
method: 1. Boil the chopped mangoes with 1 cup of water until they turn soft. 2. Strain and let it cool. 3. Blend the mango pulp with sugar, cumin powder, black salt, black pepper powder, fennel seeds, and 1 cup of water until smooth. 4. Add 2 cups of water and mix well. 5. Chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. 6. Serve with ice cubes. 7. Garnish with fresh mint leaves.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
ingredients: 500 g boneless chicken, cut into bite-size pieces
method: 1. Marinate the chicken pieces in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder, turmeric powder, and red chilli powder for at least 2 hours. 2. Preheat the oven to 200°C. 3. Thread the chicken pieces onto skewers and grill for 10-15 minutes, until cooked through. 4. Heat oil in a pan and add chopped onions. Saute until golden brown. 5. Add chopped green bell pepper and cook for 1-2 minutes. 6. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. 7. Add salt to taste. 8. Add the grilled chicken pieces and mix well. 9. Cook for 5-7 minutes, until the sauce thickens. 10. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Palak Paneer
method: 1. Heat oil in a pan and add chopped onions. Saute until golden brown. 2. Add ginger paste and garlic paste, and saute for 1-2 minutes. 3. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. 4. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chilli powder. Mix well. 5. Add blanched spinach leaves and salt to taste. Mix well. 6. Cover and cook for 10-12 minutes, until the spinach leaves are cooked through. 7. Blend the spinach mixture to a smooth puree. 8. Heat the puree in a pan and add the paneer cubes. Mix well. 9. Cook for 2-3 minutes, until the paneer is heated through. 10. Serve hot with fresh cream.

name: Chocolate Mousse
method: 1. Melt the chocolate in a double boiler and let it cool slightly. 2. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. 3. In another bowl, beat the egg yolks, sugar, vanilla essence, and salt until light and fluffy. 4. Add the melted chocolate to the egg yolk mixture and mix well. 5. Fold in the whipped cream and beaten egg whites gently. 6. Pour the mixture into individual serving bowls and chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. 7. Garnish with chocolate shavings and serve chilled.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
ingredients: 500 gms chicken breasts, cut into cubes
method: 1. Marinate the chicken with yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt for 2 hours. 2. Heat the oil in a pan and fry the onion until golden brown. 3. Add the marinated chicken and fry until cooked through. 4. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until the oil separates. 5. Add the cream and mix well. 6. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Lamb Rogan Josh
ingredients: 500 gms lamb shoulder, cut into cubes
method: 1. Marinate the lamb with yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt for 2 hours. 2. Heat the oil in a pan and fry the onion until golden brown. 3. Add the marinated lamb and fry until cooked through. 4. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until the oil separates. 5. Add the cream and mix well. 6. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Saag Paneer
method: 1. Heat oil and butter in a pan and fry the paneer until golden brown. Set aside. 2. In the same pan, add cumin seeds and fry until they splutter. 3. Add the onion and fry until golden brown. 4. Add ginger and garlic paste and fry until the raw smell disappears. 5. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. 6. Add the turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt and mix well. 7. Add the chopped spinach and cook until it wilts. 8. Add the fried paneer and mix well. 9. Add cream and mix well. 10. Serve hot.

name: Galouti Kebab
method: 1. Mix all ingredients except ghee in a bowl and knead well. 2. Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into kebabs. 3. Heat ghee in a pan and shallow fry the kebabs until browned on both sides. 4. Serve hot with mint chutney.

name: Butter Chicken
method: 1. Marinate the chicken with yoghurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt for at least 2 hours. 2. Heat butter in a pan and fry the marinated chicken until cooked through. 3. Add kasoori methi and cream and mix well. 4. Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Chaat Masala Potatoes
method: 1. Boil the potatoes until cooked through. 2. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. 3. Add the boiled potatoes and fry until golden brown. 4. Add chaat masala, red chilli powder, and salt and mix well. 5. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. 6. Serve hot as a snack or side dish.
